segment.source: When creating custom .xml files, note the following requirements:
segment.target: When creating custom .xml files, note the following requirements:

segment.source: The file must be in Unicode Transformation Format-8 (UTF-8).
segment.target: The file must be in Unicode Transformation Format-8 (UTF-8).

segment.source: You must save the file in this format, and you must specify the following syntax at the beginning of each .xml file:
segment.target: You must save the file in this format, and you must specify the following syntax at the beginning of each .xml file:

segment.source: The file must have a unique migration urlid.
segment.target: The file must have a unique migration urlid.

segment.source: The urlid of each file that you specify on the command line must be different.
segment.target: The urlid of each file that you specify on the command line must be different.

segment.source: If two migration .xml files have the same urlid, the second .xml file that is specified on the command line will not be processed.
segment.target: If two migration .xml files have the same urlid, the second .xml file that is specified on the command line will not be processed.

segment.source: This is because USMT uses the urlid to define the components within the file.
segment.target: This is because USMT uses the urlid to define the components within the file.

segment.source: For example, you must specify the following syntax at the beginning of each file:
segment.target: For example, you must specify the following syntax at the beginning of each file:

segment.source: Each component in the file must have a display name in order for it to appear in the Config.xml file.
segment.target: Each component in the file must have a display name in order for it to appear in the Config.xml file.

segment.source: This is because the Config.xml file defines the components by the display name and the migration urlid.
segment.target: This is because the Config.xml file defines the components by the display name and the migration urlid.

segment.source: For example, specify the following syntax:
segment.target: For example, specify the following syntax:

segment.source: For examples of custom .xml files, see Custom XML Examples.
segment.target: For examples of custom .xml files, see Custom XML Examples.
